metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0330 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability in the lsi53c895a device affects the latest version ofqemu. A DMA-MMIO reentrancy problem may lead to memory corruption bugs likestack overflow or use-after-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-block-extra - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-guest-agent - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-arm - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-common - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-data - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-gui - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-mips - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-misc - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-ppc - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-s390x - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-sparc - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-x86 - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-user - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-user-static - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
qemu-utils - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.11').
